Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

output.help_text: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.output`. Output directory. If it does not exist, will be created.

output_compression.description: Type: `string`, example: `gzip`, choices: ``gzip`, `lzf``. The compression format to be used on the output h5mu object
output_compression.help_text: Type: `string`, example: `gzip`, choices: ``gzip`, `lzf``. The compression format to be used on the output h5mu object.

filtering and normalization.title: Filtering and normalization
filtering and normalization.description: Arguments for filtering, normalization an log transform (see scvelo.pp.filter_and_normalize function)

min_counts.description: Type: `integer`. Minimum number of counts required for a gene to pass filtering (spliced)
min_counts.help_text: Type: `integer`. Minimum number of counts required for a gene to pass filtering (spliced).

min_counts_u.description: Type: `integer`. Minimum number of counts required for a gene to pass filtering (unspliced)
min_counts_u.help_text: Type: `integer`. Minimum number of counts required for a gene to pass filtering (unspliced).

min_cells.description: Type: `integer`. Minimum number of cells expressed required to pass filtering (spliced)
min_cells.help_text: Type: `integer`. Minimum number of cells expressed required to pass filtering (spliced).

min_cells_u.description: Type: `integer`. Minimum number of cells expressed required to pass filtering (unspliced)
min_cells_u.help_text: Type: `integer`. Minimum number of cells expressed required to pass filtering (unspliced).

min_shared_counts.description: Type: `integer`. Minimum number of counts (both unspliced and spliced) required for a gene
min_shared_counts.help_text: Type: `integer`. Minimum number of counts (both unspliced and spliced) required for a gene.

min_shared_cells.description: Type: `integer`. Minimum number of cells required to be expressed (both unspliced and spliced)
min_shared_cells.help_text: Type: `integer`. Minimum number of cells required to be expressed (both unspliced and spliced).

n_top_genes.description: Type: `integer`. Number of genes to keep
n_top_genes.help_text: Type: `integer`. Number of genes to keep.

log_transform.description: Type: `boolean`, default: `true`. Do not log transform counts
log_transform.help_text: Type: `boolean`, default: `true`. Do not log transform counts.

n_principal_components.description: Type: `integer`. Number of principal components to use for calculating moments
n_principal_components.help_text: Type: `integer`. Number of principal components to use for calculating moments.

n_neighbors.description: Type: `integer`, default: `30`. Number of neighbors to use
n_neighbors.help_text:
Type: `integer`, default: `30`. Number of neighbors to use. First/second-order moments are computed for each
cell across its nearest neighbors, where the neighbor graph is obtained from
euclidean distances in PCA space.

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.
